0.name: Numpad Notation
0.description: When using a number plus a button it corresponds to using that direction as indicated by a keyboard numpad. 4 is left, 6 is right, 8 is up, etc

4.name: (number)B
4.description: Direction pressed along with the melee button to recieve the desired melee, using numpad notation

10.name: CSA
10.description: Charge shot A, the charge bar is usually featured under your Ranged attack button ammo indicator.

11.name: CSB
11.description: Charge shot B, the charge bar is usually featured under your Melee attack button ammo indicator.

13.name: Boost Dash
13.description: Action performed by double tapping the boost button. Covers distance quickly, can be held.

14.name: Boost Step
14.description: Action performed by double tapping a cardinal direction. Removes guidance from shots fired after startup.

15.name: Ground Run
15.description: Same execution as boost dash, however some suits when standing on the ground will enter a ground run state after boosting instead of lifting off the ground.  These suits will also jump instead of a normal ascending animation when you press and hold boost

16.name: Boost Dive
16.description: Action performed from the boost dive button.  Causes you to boost towards the ground with any momentum you're currently carrying.

17.name: Vernier
17.description: Any action that stops most of your momentum and turns you to face your opponent.

18.name: Super Vernier
18.description: Not to be confused with Vernier, this is a Tallgeese 1 exclusive movement option executed by pressing a direction and a single boost button press.

19.name: Braking
19.description: On many ground run suits certain tools will force them to stop and begin boost recovery while performing the move.

20.name: Boost Hop
20.description: Boosting then pressing and holding the boost button briefly to cover the distance of several boost dashes while not using extra boost.  The momentum from the boost is carried into the hop.

21.name: Orange Step
21.description: A step performed out of a melee attack, the speed is faster than a normal step and as a result your momentum is higher during a fuwa.

22.name: Step Dive
22.description: Combination of Step and boost dive where you use step to cut your opponents guidance and immediately dive with the momentum given to you by the step.  Largely considered the strongest landing tool in the game.

23.name: Fuwa Step
23.description: Begin a sidestep and hold boost immediately after the step input.  The step will give you slight momentum as you ascend and fall.  Tapping boost can be used to end the sidestep animation early and smooth out your movement.

24.name: Ground Cancel
24.description: Advanced movement technique for a few suits.  The action is performed by using a hop melee on a suit that carries them all the way to the ground and stepping when you touch the ground and fire an attack(usually main).  This initiates a boost recovery earlier than normal.  Referred to by many other names.

0.notes: Terrible comp, opponents goal is to push damage on both of you to cause you to both die at same time.

1.notes: Premium quality teamcomp, high power and self defense on both suits

2.notes: Premium quality teamcomp, loss of firepower compared to 400 but less risky

3.notes: Weak comp, 200 struggles to contribute while still out-surviving the 500

0.notes: Premium quality teamcomp, high power and self defense on both suits

1.notes: Weak comp, no real benefit from taking a 400 instead of a 500 but the firepower loss is substantial

2.notes: Weak comp, low firepower means high degrees of teamplay and risk taking will be required

3.notes: Premium teamcomp, 400 can adequately protect itself, direct attention, and follow up on the 200

0.notes: Premium quality teamcomp, loss of firepower compared to 400 but less risky

1.notes: Weak comp, low firepower means high degrees of teamplay and risk taking will be required

2.notes: First life both will play front, intending on bursting and dying around the same time.  On second life the player taking more damage should take the last life while the healthier suit ensures he can survive his partners death.  Use of half bursts and faster-paced play reccomended to compensate the suit's lower capabilities.

3.notes: 300 has to play a support role to allow the 200 to get his lives but you have to take risks to follow up on the 200's plays.  Suit dependant comp.

0.notes: Weak comp, 200 struggles to contribute while still out-surviving the 500

1.notes: Premium teamcomp, 400 can adequately protect itself, direct attention, and follow up on the 200

2.notes: 300 has to play a support role to allow the 200 to get his lives but you have to take risks to follow up on the 200's plays.  Suit dependant comp.

3.notes: Low firepower and predictable gameplay means you're just throwing yourselves at your opponents 2v1 and hoping to keep the game in utter chaos so you can score hits/trades.
